title: Chelsfield Circular Walk Route

images.title: David Anstiss / Footpath junction near Gables Farm
images.caption: Footpath junction near Gables Farm. Footpath from Darns Hill, Crockenhill leads straight on to Dalton Road. Also a footpath heads over the stile to Gorse Road, past Crown Wood

description: This short circular walk follows footpaths and tracks through the countryside around Chelsfield in Bromley. The walk starts at Chelsfield station and heads towards Crockenhall through farmland and woodland, before returning to Chelsfield via Goddington. The walk is located just to the east of Orpington .

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: After your exercise you could enjoy rest and refreshment at the Five Bells in Chelsfield village. The historic pub dates all the way back to 1668 and includes a cosy interior and a spacious garden area. You can find them at postcode BR6 7RE for your sat navs.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The country trails make for a pleasant dog walk and the Five Bells mentioned above is also dog friendly.

display_address: The Highway, Goddington, London Borough of Bromley, London, Greater London, England, BR6 9UJ, United Kingdom
